jcurses.system

Class Toolkit

  • java.lang.Object
    • jcurses.system.Toolkit

  • public class Toolkit
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the 'work factory' of the jcurses library. It contains methods for primitive input and output operations and is only interface to platform dependend libraries. An developer must not usually call methods of this class, these are used implementing widgets and in jcurses core.

    • Method Detail

      • setClipRectangle

        public static void setClipRectangle(Rectangle clipRect)
        The method sets the clippping rectangle for the current thread. All the output operations, that are performed by this thread after a call of this method, will paint only within the clip rectangle. If other clips were set before this, then the used clip rectangle is the intersection of all clip rectangles set by current thread.
        Parameters:
        clipRect - clip rectangle to be set

      • unsetClipRectangle

        public static void unsetClipRectangle()
        Removes the evtl. before set clip rectangle

      • startPainting

        public static void startPainting()
        The method starts a new painting action, containing possible many painting operations After a call of this method endPainting must be already called, to refersh the screen.

      • endPainting

        public static void endPainting()
        The method ends a new painting action, containing possible many painting operations The call of this method must already follow a call of startPainting

      • getScreenWidth

        public static int getScreenWidth()
        The method returns the screen width
        Returns:
        the screen height

      • getScreenHeight

        public static int getScreenHeight()
        The method returns the screen height
        Returns:
        the screen height

      • hasColors

        public static boolean hasColors()
        Returns:
        true if the terminal can color painting, falseotherwise.

      • init

        public static void init()
        The method initializes the jcurses library, must be called only one time before all painting and input operations.

      • shutdown

        public static void shutdown()
        The method shuts down the jcurses library and recovers the terminal to the state before jcurses application start.

      • clearScreen

        public static void clearScreen(CharColor color)
        The method clears the screen and fills it with the backround color of color
        Parameters:
        color - the color to fill the screen, only backround part is used.

      • drawRectangle

        public static void drawRectangle(Rectangle rect,
                 CharColor color)
        The method draws a rectangle on the screen, filled with background part of color
        Parameters:
        rect - rectangle ( that is, bounds of rectangle) to be painted
        color - color to fill the rectangle, only background part is used

      • drawRectangle

        public static void drawRectangle(int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 CharColor color)
        The method draws a rectangle on the screen, filled with background part of color
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle to be painted
        y - the y coordinate of the top left corner of the rectangle to be painted
        width - the width of the rectangle to be painted
        heigtht - the height of the rectangle to be painted
        color - color to fill the rectangle, only background part is used

      • drawCorner

        public static void drawCorner(int startX,
              int startY,
              int endX,
              int endY,
              CharColor color,
              short alignment)
        The method draws a corner. The corner cann't have only one long side and the othe side empty. In such case drawLine must be user followed by painting a sidelos corner.
        Parameters:
        startX - the x coordinate of the start point
        startY - the y coordinate of the start point
        endX - the x coordinate of the end point
        endY - the y coordinate of the end point
        alignment - this parameter states, whether the line, that connects the start point with end point, lies UNDER the corner point (alignment == 0 ) or OVER (alignment == 1), or the corner char, if the corner has no sides, it.

      • drawBorder

        public static void drawBorder(Rectangle rect,
              CharColor color)
        The method draws a border ( empty rectangle )
        Parameters:
        rect - bounds of the border to be painted
        color - color attributes of the border

      • drawBorder

        public static void drawBorder(int x,

        y - the y coordinate of the top left corner of the border to be painted
        width - the width of the border to be painted
        heigtht - the height of the border to be painted
        color - color attributes of the border

      • printString

        public static void printString(java.lang.String text,
               Rectangle rect,
               CharColor color)
        The method prints a string on the screen
        Parameters:
        text - string to be printed
        rectangle - the rectangle, within which the string must lie. If the string doesn't fit within the rectangle it will be broken.
        colr - attributes of the string

      • printString

        public static void printString(java.lang.String text,
               int x,
               int y,
               CharColor color)
        The method prints a string on the screen
        Parameters:
        text - string to be printed
        x - the x coordinate of the string start point
        y - the y coordinate of the string start point
        color - color attributes of the string

      • printString

        public static void printString(java.lang.String text,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height,
               CharColor color)
        The method prints a string on the screen. If the string doesn't fit within the rectangle bounds, it wiil be broken.
        Parameters:
        text - string to be printed
        x - the x coordinate of the string start point
        y - the y coordinate of the string start point
        width - the width of bounds rectangle
        height - the width of bounds rectangle
        color - color attributes of the string

      • readCharacter

        public static InputChar readCharacter()
        The method reads the next code (ascii or control ) fro input stream an wraps it into an instance of InputChar
        Returns:
        the next read code

      • changeColors

        public static void changeColors(Rectangle rect,
                CharColor color)
        The method change the background and the foreground colors of an given rectangle on the schreen
        Parameters:
        rectangle - rectangle, whose colors are to be changed
        colors - new colors

      • beep

        public static void beep()
        The method to make an audio alert. Works only with terminals, that support 'beeps', under windows currenty does nothing.
